attributes.action: The Abolition of West Midlands Police
attributes.additional_details:
The Abolition of West Midlands Police - Publicly reinforcing acceptable standards of conduct, integrity, responsibility and law enforcement for Crown Officers of the UK Member State for Europe, via the extension of the policing areas of Staffordshire (34) and Warwickshire (39).

In view of the overwhelming costs to the State and the substantive evidence which has been discharged into the public domain since 1974 demonstrating they are unfit for purpose.  Re: consistent and protracted efforts in relation to evidence tampering, falsification of evidence, complicity and perjury, systemic corruption, passing information, GBH, assault, repeated violations of human rights, inhumane and degrading treatment of the citizens of the West Midlands (which is inclusive of murder in custody), trial fixing, obstruction and perversion of the course of justice at both a national and local level.  E.g. premeditated failure of the IPCC’ Hillsborough investigation.
